00035 #if !defined(_XED_ILD_H_)
00036 # define _XED_ILD_H_

00044     
00045     /**********************************************************************/
00046     /*                                                                    */
00047     /* THIS CODE IS INCOMPLETE, EXPERIMENTAL AND SUBJECT TO CHANGE AT     */
00048     /* ANY TIME! DO NOT USE THIS CODE YET!                                */

00052 /* ILD-related defines:
00053  *
00054  * XED_ILD - for building ILD module 
00055  * XED_ILD_CHECK  for using ILD module in decoding and checking 
00056  *                results against regular decode
00057  * XED_ILD_ONLY - for using only ILD for length decoding, without
00058  *                regular decoding. This is for performance measurements.
00059  */
00060 
00061 XED_INLINE static xed_uint_t xed_modrm_mod(xed_uint8_t m) { return m>>6; }
00062 XED_INLINE static xed_uint_t xed_modrm_reg(xed_uint8_t m) { return (m>>3)&7; }
00063 XED_INLINE static xed_uint_t xed_modrm_rm(xed_uint8_t m) { return m&7; }
00064 XED_INLINE static xed_uint_t xed_sib_scale(xed_uint8_t m) { return m>>6; }
00065 XED_INLINE static xed_uint_t xed_sib_index(xed_uint8_t m) { return (m>>3)&7; }
00066 XED_INLINE static xed_uint_t xed_sib_base(xed_uint8_t m) { return m&7; }
00067 XED_INLINE static xed_uint_t bits2bytes(xed_uint_t bits) { return bits>>3; }
00068 
00069 /*
00070  * To allow the ILD to record information for nonpublic extensions, we
00071  * allow adding fields to the xed_ild_extended_t at compile time by
00072  * generating xed-ild-extension.h that defines
00073  * xed_ild_extended_t type.  The implication of this model, is that
00074  * downstream extension models must be supersets of all the extensions that
00075  * they compose with. FIXME: cook up a way to synthesize/generate the
00076  * xed-ild-extension.h file and type definition from all the fields in
00077  * relevant models at compile time.
00078  */
00079 
00080 #include "xed-ild-extension.h"
00081 
00082 
00083 typedef enum {
00084     XED_ILD_MAP0=0,
00085     XED_ILD_MAP1=1,
00086     XED_ILD_MAP2=2,
00087     XED_ILD_MAP3=3,
00088     XED_ILD_MAPAMD, /* 3dnow */
00089     XED_ILD_MAP_XOP8=8,
00090     XED_ILD_MAP_XOP9=9,
00091     XED_ILD_MAP_XOPA=10, 
00092     XED_ILD_INVALID_MAP=0xFF
00093 } xed_ild_map_enum_t;
00094 
00095 #define ILD_ITEXT_MAX_BYTES 15
00096 
00097 #define XED_GRAMMAR_MODE_64 2
00098 #define XED_GRAMMAR_MODE_32 1
00099 #define XED_GRAMMAR_MODE_16 0
00100 
00101 typedef struct  {
00102     /* init/configuration variables */
00103     xed_bits_t mmode;  /* machine mode in XED GRAMMAR format: 0/1/2 */
00104     xed_chip_enum_t chip;
00105     const xed_uint8_t* itext;
00106     xed_uint_t  max_bytes; 
00107     xed_uint_t out_of_bytes; /* 1 if max_bytes bound was reached while
00108                               * scanning itext 
00109                               */
00110 
00111     /* observed variables */
00112     xed_uint_t  length;    /* the observed length */
00113     
00114     /* to get the count of real legacy prefixes, subtract the number of rex
00115        prefixes from nprefixes.  There is only one rex prefix that is used;
00116        but any rex-s that are mixed-in with the legacy prefixes are
00117        ignored! We must count them. */
00118     xed_uint_t  nprefixes; /* count of legacy and rex prefixes */
00119     xed_uint_t  nrexes;    /* count of rex prefixes */
00120     
00121     xed_uint_t  nseg_prefexies; /* count of segment prefixes */
00122 
00123     
00124     xed_uint8_t found; /* NDY - found a valid inst */
00125     xed_uint8_t osz;  /* if 66 was observed */
00126     xed_uint8_t asz;  /* if 67 was observed */
00127     xed_uint8_t seg;  /* the last seg prefix */
00128     xed_uint8_t lock; /* 1 or 0 */
00129     xed_uint8_t f2;  /* 1 or 0 */
00130     xed_uint8_t f3;  /* 1 or 0 */
00131     xed_uint8_t last_f2f3; /* f2 or f3 */
00132     xed_uint8_t first_f2f3;  /* f2 or f3 */
00133     xed_uint8_t rex; /* rex value */
00134     xed_uint8_t vex; /* c4 or c5 */
00135     xed_uint8_t nominal_opcode;
00136     xed_uint8_t nominal_opcode_position; /* 0 is first ... */
00137 
00138      /* required for sib processing */
00139     xed_uint8_t modrm; /* value of byte if has_modrm is nonzero*/
00140     
00141     xed_ild_map_enum_t map; 
00142     xed_uint8_t amd3dnow; /* 1 or 0 */
00143     xed_uint8_t rex_w;
00144     xed_uint8_t rex_r;
00145     xed_uint8_t rex_x;
00146     xed_uint8_t rex_b;
00147     xed_uint8_t vex_l;
00148     xed_uint8_t vex_pp;
00149     xed_uint8_t vex_w;
00150 
00151     /* decode-time derived variables */
00152     xed_bool_t has_modrm;
00153     xed_bool_t has_sib;
00154     xed_uint8_t imm_bytes;   /* 0=none, else 1,2,4,8 */
00155     /*has_imm1 is for AMD's double immediate insstructions */
00156     xed_uint8_t imm1_bytes;   /* 0=none, else 1,2 */
00157     xed_uint8_t disp_bytes;  /* 0=none, else 1,2,4,8 */
00158 
00159     /* position of the back-end bytes */
00160     xed_uint8_t pos_modrm;
00161     xed_uint8_t pos_sib;
00162     xed_uint8_t pos_imm;
00163     xed_uint8_t pos_imm1; //for AMD's second immediate
00164     xed_uint8_t pos_disp;
00165 
00166     xed_ild_extended_t ext;
00167 } xed_ild_t;
00168 
00169 XED_DLL_EXPORT void xed_ild_init(xed_ild_t* x,
00170                                  xed_machine_mode_enum_t mmode,
00171                                  xed_chip_enum_t chip,
00172                                  const xed_uint8_t* itext,
00173                                  const xed_uint_t  max_bytes);
00174 
00175 
00177 void xed_ild_init_decoder(void);

00187 xed_instruction_length_decode(xed_ild_t* ild);
